speaker: PROTEUS
text_entry: SCENE VII. Verona. JULIA'S house.

speaker: PROTEUS
text_entry: Enter JULIA and LUCETTA

speaker: JULIA
text_entry: Counsel, Lucetta; gentle girl, assist me;

speaker: JULIA
text_entry: And even in kind love I do conjure thee,

speaker: JULIA
text_entry: Who art the table wherein all my thoughts

speaker: JULIA
text_entry: Are visibly character'd and engraved,

speaker: JULIA
text_entry: To lesson me and tell me some good mean

speaker: JULIA
text_entry: How, with my honour, I may undertake

speaker: JULIA
text_entry: A journey to my loving Proteus.

speaker: LUCETTA
text_entry: Alas, the way is wearisome and long!

speaker: JULIA
text_entry: A true-devoted pilgrim is not weary

speaker: JULIA
text_entry: To measure kingdoms with his feeble steps;

speaker: JULIA
text_entry: Much less shall she that hath Love's wings to fly,

speaker: JULIA
text_entry: And when the flight is made to one so dear,

speaker: JULIA
text_entry: Of such divine perfection, as Sir Proteus.

speaker: LUCETTA
text_entry: Better forbear till Proteus make return.

speaker: JULIA
text_entry: O, know'st thou not his looks are my soul's food?

speaker: JULIA
text_entry: Pity the dearth that I have pined in,

speaker: JULIA
text_entry: By longing for that food so long a time.

speaker: JULIA
text_entry: Didst thou but know the inly touch of love,

speaker: JULIA
text_entry: Thou wouldst as soon go kindle fire with snow

speaker: JULIA
text_entry: As seek to quench the fire of love with words.

speaker: LUCETTA
text_entry: I do not seek to quench your love's hot fire,

speaker: LUCETTA
text_entry: But qualify the fire's extreme rage,

speaker: LUCETTA
text_entry: Lest it should burn above the bounds of reason.

speaker: JULIA
text_entry: The more thou damm'st it up, the more it burns.

speaker: JULIA
text_entry: The current that with gentle murmur glides,

speaker: JULIA
text_entry: Thou know'st, being stopp'd, impatiently doth rage;

speaker: JULIA
text_entry: But when his fair course is not hindered,

speaker: JULIA
text_entry: He makes sweet music with the enamell'ed stones,

speaker: JULIA
text_entry: Giving a gentle kiss to every sedge

speaker: JULIA
text_entry: He overtaketh in his pilgrimage,

speaker: JULIA
text_entry: And so by many winding nooks he strays

speaker: JULIA
text_entry: With willing sport to the wild ocean.

speaker: JULIA
text_entry: Then let me go and hinder not my course

speaker: JULIA
text_entry: I'll be as patient as a gentle stream

speaker: JULIA
text_entry: And make a pastime of each weary step,

speaker: JULIA
text_entry: Till the last step have brought me to my love;

speaker: JULIA
text_entry: And there I'll rest, as after much turmoil

speaker: JULIA
text_entry: A blessed soul doth in Elysium.

speaker: LUCETTA
text_entry: But in what habit will you go along?

speaker: JULIA
text_entry: Not like a woman; for I would prevent

speaker: JULIA
text_entry: The loose encounters of lascivious men:

speaker: JULIA
text_entry: Gentle Lucetta, fit me with such weeds

speaker: JULIA
text_entry: As may beseem some well-reputed page.

speaker: LUCETTA
text_entry: Why, then, your ladyship must cut your hair.

speaker: JULIA
text_entry: No, girl, I'll knit it up in silken strings

speaker: JULIA
text_entry: With twenty odd-conceited true-love knots.

speaker: JULIA
text_entry: To be fantastic may become a youth

speaker: JULIA
text_entry: Of greater time than I shall show to be.

speaker: LUCETTA
text_entry: What fashion, madam shall I make your breeches?

speaker: JULIA
text_entry: That fits as well as 'Tell me, good my lord,

speaker: JULIA
text_entry: What compass will you wear your farthingale?'

speaker: JULIA
text_entry: Why even what fashion thou best likest, Lucetta.

speaker: LUCETTA
text_entry: You must needs have them with a codpiece, madam.

speaker: JULIA
text_entry: Out, out, Lucetta! that would be ill-favour'd.

speaker: LUCETTA
text_entry: A round hose, madam, now's not worth a pin,

speaker: LUCETTA
text_entry: Unless you have a codpiece to stick pins on.

speaker: JULIA
text_entry: Lucetta, as thou lovest me, let me have

speaker: JULIA
text_entry: What thou thinkest meet and is most mannerly.

speaker: JULIA
text_entry: But tell me, wench, how will the world repute me

speaker: JULIA
text_entry: For undertaking so unstaid a journey?

speaker: JULIA
text_entry: I fear me, it will make me scandalized.

speaker: LUCETTA
text_entry: If you think so, then stay at home and go not.

speaker: JULIA
text_entry: Nay, that I will not.

speaker: LUCETTA
text_entry: Then never dream on infamy, but go.

speaker: LUCETTA
text_entry: If Proteus like your journey when you come,

speaker: LUCETTA
text_entry: No matter who's displeased when you are gone:

speaker: LUCETTA
text_entry: I fear me, he will scarce be pleased withal.

speaker: JULIA
text_entry: That is the least, Lucetta, of my fear:

speaker: JULIA
text_entry: A thousand oaths, an ocean of his tears

speaker: JULIA
text_entry: And instances of infinite of love

speaker: JULIA
text_entry: Warrant me welcome to my Proteus.

speaker: LUCETTA
text_entry: All these are servants to deceitful men.

speaker: JULIA
text_entry: Base men, that use them to so base effect!

speaker: JULIA
text_entry: But truer stars did govern Proteus' birth

speaker: JULIA
text_entry: His words are bonds, his oaths are oracles,

speaker: JULIA
text_entry: His love sincere, his thoughts immaculate,

speaker: JULIA
text_entry: His tears pure messengers sent from his heart,

speaker: JULIA
text_entry: His heart as far from fraud as heaven from earth.

speaker: LUCETTA
text_entry: Pray heaven he prove so, when you come to him!

speaker: JULIA
text_entry: Now, as thou lovest me, do him not that wrong

speaker: JULIA
text_entry: To bear a hard opinion of his truth:

speaker: JULIA
text_entry: Only deserve my love by loving him;

speaker: JULIA
text_entry: And presently go with me to my chamber,

speaker: JULIA
text_entry: To take a note of what I stand in need of,

speaker: JULIA
text_entry: To furnish me upon my longing journey.

speaker: JULIA
text_entry: All that is mine I leave at thy dispose,

speaker: JULIA
text_entry: My goods, my lands, my reputation;

speaker: JULIA
text_entry: Only, in lieu thereof, dispatch me hence.

speaker: JULIA
text_entry: Come, answer not, but to it presently!

speaker: JULIA
text_entry: I am impatient of my tarriance.

speaker: JULIA
text_entry: Exeunt
